info.title: DeploymentStacksClient
info.description: The APIs listed in this specification can be used to manage Deployment stack resources through the Azure Resource Manager.

get.description: Lists Deployment stacks at the specified scope.
Gets the Deployment stack with the given name.

put.description: Creates or updates a Deployment stack at the specified scope.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

delete.description: Deletes a Deployment stack by name at the specified scope. When operation completes, status code 200 returned without content.

post.description: Exports the template used to create the Deployment stack at the specified scope.

get.description: Lists Deployment stacks at the specified scope.
Gets the Deployment stack with the given name.

put.description: Creates or updates a Deployment stack at the specified scope.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

delete.description: Deletes a Deployment stack by name at the specified scope. When operation completes, status code 200 returned without content.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

post.description: Exports the template used to create the Deployment stack at the specified scope.
Runs preflight validation on the Deployment stack template at the specified scope to verify its acceptance to Azure Resource Manager.

parameters.name: deploymentStack
parameters.description: The content of the action request

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

ActionOnUnmanage.description: Defines the behavior of resources that are no longer managed after the stack is updated or deleted.

resources.description: Specifies an action for a newly unmanaged resource. Delete will attempt to delete the resource from Azure. Detach will leave the resource in it's current state.

resourceGroups.description: Specifies an action for a newly unmanaged resource. Delete will attempt to delete the resource from Azure. Detach will leave the resource in it's current state.

managementGroups.description: Specifies an action for a newly unmanaged resource. Delete will attempt to delete the resource from Azure. Detach will leave the resource in it's current state.

DenySettings.description: Defines how resources deployed by the Deployment stack are locked.

mode.description: denySettings Mode that defines denied actions.

excludedPrincipals.description: List of AAD principal IDs excluded from the lock. Up to 5 principals are permitted.

excludedActions.description: List of role-based management operations that are excluded from the denySettings. Up to 200 actions are permitted. If the denySetting mode is set to 'denyWriteAndDelete', then the following actions are automatically appended to 'excludedActions': '*\/read' and 'Microsoft.Authorization/locks/delete'. If the denySetting mode is set to 'denyDelete', then the following actions are automatically appended to 'excludedActions': 'Microsoft.Authorization/locks/delete'. Duplicate actions will be removed.

applyToChildScopes.description: DenySettings will be applied to child resource scopes of every managed resource with a deny assignment.

DenySettingsMode.description: denySettings Mode that defines denied actions.

values.name: DenyDelete
values.description: Authorized users are able to read and modify the resources, but cannot delete.

values.name: DenyWriteAndDelete
values.description: Authorized users can read from a resource, but cannot modify or delete it.

values.name: None
values.description: No denyAssignments have been applied.

DenyStatusMode.description: denyAssignment settings applied to the resource.

values.name: DenyDelete
values.description: Authorized users are able to read and modify the resources, but cannot delete.

values.name: NotSupported
values.description: Resource type does not support denyAssignments.

values.name: Inapplicable
values.description: denyAssignments are not supported on resources outside the scope of the deployment stack.

values.name: DenyWriteAndDelete
values.description: Authorized users can only read from a resource, but cannot modify or delete it.

values.name: RemovedBySystem
values.description: Deny assignment has been removed by Azure due to a resource management change (management group move, etc.)

values.name: None
values.description: No denyAssignments have been applied.

DeploymentExtension.description: Details about the usage of a deployment extension.

configId.description: The configuration ID of the extension usage. It uniquely identifies a target the extension deploys to.

config.description: The configuration used for deployment. The keys of this object are config property names.

DeploymentExtensionConfig.description: The configuration of a single deployment extension. The keys of this object are extension aliases as defined in the deployment template.

DeploymentExtensionConfigItem.description: The value or how to get a value for an extension config property.

value.description: The value of the config item. The type is determined by the extension config schema.

keyVaultReference.description: The key vault reference of the config item.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives. Required for subscription and management group scoped stacks. The location is inherited from the resource group for resource group scoped stacks.

values.name: Info
values.description: Informational message.

values.name: Warning
values.description: Warning message.

values.name: Error
values.description: Error message.

DeploymentStackListResult.description: The response of a DeploymentStack list operation.

value.description: The DeploymentStack items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

DeploymentStackManagementStatus.description: The management status of the deployment stack resource.

values.name: Managed
values.description: The resource is managed by the deployment stack.

values.name: Unmanaged
values.description: The resource is not managed by the deployment stack.

values.name: Unknown
values.description: The management state of the resource could not be determined.

template.description: The template content. You use this element when you want to pass the template syntax directly in the request rather than link to an existing template. It can be a JObject or well-formed JSON string. Use either the templateLink property or the template property, but not both.

templateLink.description: The URI of the template. Use either the templateLink property or the template property, but not both.

parameters.description: Name and value pairs that define the deployment parameters for the template. Use this element when providing the parameter values directly in the request, rather than linking to an existing parameter file. Use either the parametersLink property or the parameters property, but not both.

extensionConfigs.description: The deployment extension configs. Keys of this object are extension aliases as defined in the deployment template.

parametersLink.description: The URI of parameters file. Use this element to link to an existing parameters file. Use either the parametersLink property or the parameters property, but not both.

actionOnUnmanage.description: Defines the behavior of resources that are no longer managed after the Deployment stack is updated or deleted.

debugSetting.description: The debug setting of the deployment.

deploymentScope.description: The scope at which the initial deployment should be created. If a scope is not specified, it will default to the scope of the deployment stack. Valid scopes are: management group (format: '/providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/{managementGroupId}'), subscription (format: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}'), resource group (format: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}').

description.description: Deployment stack description. Max length of 4096 characters.

denySettings.description: Defines how resources deployed by the stack are locked.

correlationId.description: The correlation id of the last Deployment stack upsert or delete operation. It is in GUID format and is used for tracing.

validationLevel.description: The validation level of the deployment stack

bypassStackOutOfSyncError.description: Flag to bypass service errors that indicate the stack resource list is not correctly synchronized.

detachedResources.description: An array of resources that were detached during the most recent Deployment stack update. Detached means that the resource was removed from the template, but no relevant deletion operations were specified. So, the resource still exists while no longer being associated with the stack.

deletedResources.description: An array of resources that were deleted during the most recent Deployment stack update. Deleted means that the resource was removed from the template and relevant deletion operations were specified.

failedResources.description: An array of resources that failed to reach goal state during the most recent update. Each resourceId is accompanied by an error message.

resources.description: An array of resources currently managed by the deployment stack.

deploymentExtensions.description: The extensions used during deployment. Contains extension data for all extensible resources managed by the stack.

deploymentId.description: The resourceId of the deployment resource created by the deployment stack.

outputs.description: The outputs of the deployment resource created by the deployment stack.

duration.description: The duration of the last successful Deployment stack update.

values.name: Creating
values.description: The deployment stack is currently being created

values.name: Validating
values.description: The deployment stack is currently being validated

values.name: Waiting
values.description: The deployment stack is currently waiting

values.name: Deploying
values.description: The deployment stack is currently deploying

values.name: Canceling
values.description: The deployment stack is being cancelled

values.name: UpdatingDenyAssignments
values.description: The deployment stack is updating deny assignments

values.name: DeletingResources
values.description: The deployment stack is deleting resources

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The deployment stack completed successfully

values.name: Failed
values.description: The deployment stack has failed

values.name: Canceled
values.description: The deployment stack has been cancelled

values.name: Deleting
values.description: The deployment stack is being deleted

DeploymentStackTemplateDefinition.description: Export Template specific properties of the Deployment stack.

template.description: The template content. Use this element to pass the template syntax directly in the request rather than link to an existing template. It can be a JObject or well-formed JSON string. Use either the templateLink property or the template property, but not both.

templateLink.description: The URI of the template. Use either the templateLink property or the template property, but not both.

DeploymentStackValidateProperties.description: The Deployment stack validation result details.

actionOnUnmanage.description: Defines the behavior of resources that are no longer managed after the Deployment stack is updated or deleted.

correlationId.description: The correlation id of the Deployment stack validate operation. It is in GUID format and is used for tracing.

validatedResources.description: The array of resources that were validated.

validationLevel.description: The validation level of the deployment stack

id.description: String Id used to locate any resource on Azure.

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

DeploymentStackWhatIfChange.description: Changes predicted to the deployment stack as a result of the what-if operation.

resourceChanges.description: List of resource changes predicted by What-If operation.

denySettingsChange.description: Predicted changes to the deployment stack deny settings.

before.description: The predicted value before the deployment is executed.

after.description: The predicted value after the deployment is executed.

delta.description: The predicted changes to the properties."

deploymentScopeChange.description: Predicted changes to the deployment scope for the deployment stack.

before.description: The predicted value before the deployment is executed.

after.description: The predicted value after the deployment is executed.

DeploymentStackWhatIfChangeCertainty.description: Denotes the confidence level of the predicted change.

values.name: Definite
values.description: The change is definite.

values.name: Potential
values.description: The change may or may not happen, based on deployment-time conditions.

DeploymentStackWhatIfChangeType.description: Type of change that will be made to the resource when the deployment is executed.

values.name: Create
values.description: The resource does not exist in the current state but is present in the desired state. The resource will be created when the deployment is executed.

values.name: Delete
values.description: The resource exists in the current state and is missing from the desired state. The resource will be deleted from Azure after the deployment is executed.

values.name: Detach
values.description: The resource exists in the current state and is missing from the desired state. The resource will be removed from the deployment stack, but will remain in Azure, after the deployment is executed.

values.name: Modify
values.description: The resource exists in the current state and the desired state and will be redeployed when the deployment is executed. The properties of the resource will change.

values.name: NoChange
values.description: The resource exists in the current state and the desired state and will be redeployed when the deployment is executed. The properties of the resource will not change.

DeploymentStackWhatIfPropertyChange.description: The predicted change to the resource property.

before.description: The predicted value before the deployment is executed.

after.description: The predicted value after the deployment is executed.

path.description: Type of change that will be made to the resource when the deployment is executed.

changeType.description: Type of change that will be made to the resource when the deployment is executed.

values.name: Array
values.description: The property is an array and contains nested changes.

values.name: Create
values.description: The property does not exist in the current state but is present in the desired state. The property will be created when the deployment is executed.

values.name: Delete
values.description: The property exists in the current state and is missing from the desired state. It will be deleted when the deployment is executed.

values.name: Modify
values.description: The property exists in both current and desired state and is different. The value of the property will change when the deployment is executed.

values.name: NoEffect
values.description: The property will not be set or updated.

DeploymentStackWhatIfResourceChange.description: Information about a single resource change predicted by What-If operation.

before.description: The predicted value before the deployment is executed.

after.description: The predicted value after the deployment is executed.

delta.description: The predicted changes to the properties."

resourceId.description: The resource id of the resource being changed.

deploymentId.description: The resource id of the Deployment responsible for this change.

symbolicName.description: The symbolic name of the resource being changed.

changeType.description: Type of change that will be made to the resource when the deployment is executed.

changeCertainty.description: The confidence level of the predicted change.

managementStatusChange.description: The predicted changes to the deployment stack management status of the resource.

before.description: The predicted value before the deployment is executed.

after.description: The predicted value after the deployment is executed.

denyStatusChange.description: The predicted changes to the deployment stack deny status of the resource.

before.description: The predicted value before the deployment is executed.

after.description: The predicted value after the deployment is executed.

unsupportedReason.description: The explanation about why the resource is unsupported by What-If.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives. Required for subscription and management group scoped stacks. The location is inherited from the resource group for resource group scoped stacks.

DeploymentStackWhatIfResultListResult.description: The response of a DeploymentStackWhatIfResult list operation.

value.description: The DeploymentStackWhatIfResult items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

template.description: The template content. You use this element when you want to pass the template syntax directly in the request rather than link to an existing template. It can be a JObject or well-formed JSON string. Use either the templateLink property or the template property, but not both.

templateLink.description: The URI of the template. Use either the templateLink property or the template property, but not both.

parameters.description: Name and value pairs that define the deployment parameters for the template. Use this element when providing the parameter values directly in the request, rather than linking to an existing parameter file. Use either the parametersLink property or the parameters property, but not both.

extensionConfigs.description: The deployment extension configs. Keys of this object are extension aliases as defined in the deployment template.

parametersLink.description: The URI of parameters file. Use this element to link to an existing parameters file. Use either the parametersLink property or the parameters property, but not both.

actionOnUnmanage.description: Defines the behavior of resources that are no longer managed after the Deployment stack is updated or deleted.

debugSetting.description: The debug setting of the deployment.

deploymentScope.description: The scope at which the initial deployment should be created. If a scope is not specified, it will default to the scope of the deployment stack. Valid scopes are: management group (format: '/providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/{managementGroupId}'), subscription (format: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}'), resource group (format: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}').

description.description: Deployment stack description. Max length of 4096 characters.

denySettings.description: Defines how resources deployed by the stack are locked.

correlationId.description: The correlation id of the last Deployment stack upsert or delete operation. It is in GUID format and is used for tracing.

validationLevel.description: The validation level of the deployment stack

deploymentStackId.description: The deployment stack id to use as the basis for comparison.

retentionInterval.description: The interval to persist the deployment stack what-if result in ISO 8601 format.

changes.description: All of the changes predicted by the deployment stack what-if operation.

diagnostics.description: List of resource diagnostics detected by What-If operation.

detailLevel.description: Specifies the type of information to log for debugging. The permitted values are none, requestContent, responseContent, or both requestContent and responseContent separated by a comma. The default is none. When setting this value, carefully consider the type of information that is being passed in during deployment. By logging information about the request or response, sensitive data that is retrieved through the deployment operations could potentially be exposed.

DeploymentStacksDeleteDetachEnum.description: Specifies an action for a newly unmanaged resource. Delete will attempt to delete the resource from Azure. Detach will leave the resource in it's current state.

values.name: Delete
values.description: Delete the specified resources from Azure

values.name: Detach
values.description: Keep the specified resources in Azure

DeploymentStacksParametersLink.description: Entity representing the reference to the deployment parameters.

uri.description: The URI of the parameters file.

contentVersion.description: If included, must match the ContentVersion in the template.

DeploymentStacksTemplateLink.description: Entity representing the reference to the template.

uri.description: The URI of the template to deploy. Use either the uri or id property, but not both.

id.description: The resourceId of a Template Spec. Use either the id or uri property, but not both.

relativePath.description: The relativePath property can be used to deploy a linked template at a location relative to the parent. If the parent template was linked with a TemplateSpec, this will reference an artifact in the TemplateSpec.  If the parent was linked with a URI, the child deployment will be a combination of the parent and relativePath URIs.

queryString.description: The query string (for example, a SAS token) to be used with the templateLink URI.

contentVersion.description: If included, must match the ContentVersion in the template.

status.description: Current management state of the resource in the deployment stack.

denyStatus.description: denyAssignment settings applied to the resource.

values.name: DenyDelete
values.description: Authorized users are able to read and modify the resources, but cannot delete.

values.name: NotSupported
values.description: Resource type does not support denyAssignments.

values.name: Inapplicable
values.description: denyAssignments are not supported on resources outside the scope of the deployment stack.

values.name: DenyWriteAndDelete
values.description: Authorized users can only read from a resource, but cannot modify or delete it.

values.name: RemovedBySystem
values.description: Deny assignment has been removed by Azure due to a resource management change (management group move, etc.)

values.name: None
values.description: No denyAssignments have been applied.

id.description: The ARM Resource ID of a resource managed by the deployment stack.

extension.description: The extension the resource was deployed with.

apiVersion.description: The API version the resource was deployed with

ResourceReferenceExtended.description: The resourceId extended model. This is used to document failed resources with a resourceId and a corresponding error.

id.description: The ARM Resource ID of a resource managed by the deployment stack.

extension.description: The extension the resource was deployed with.

apiVersion.description: The API version the resource was deployed with

ResourceStatusMode.description: Current management state of the resource in the deployment stack.

values.name: Managed
values.description: This resource is managed by the deployment stack.

values.name: RemoveDenyFailed
values.description: Unable to remove the deny assignment on resource.

values.name: DeleteFailed
values.description: Unable to delete the resource from Azure. The delete will be retried on the next stack deployment, or can be deleted manually.

ValidationLevel.description: The level of validation performed on the deployment.

values.name: Template
values.description: Static analysis of the template is performed.

values.name: Provider
values.description: Static analysis of the template is performed and resource declarations are sent to resource providers for semantic validation. Validates that the caller has RBAC write permissions on each resource.

values.name: ProviderNoRbac
values.description: Static analysis of the template is performed and resource declarations are sent to resource providers for semantic validation. Skips validating that the caller has RBAC write permissions on each resource.

ActionOnUnmanageDeleteParameters.bypassS.name: bypassStackOutOfSyncError
ActionOnUnmanageDeleteParameters.bypassS.description: Flag to bypass service errors that indicate the stack resource list is not correctly synchronized.

ActionOnUnmanageDeleteParameters.unmanag.name: unmanageAction.ManagementGroups
ActionOnUnmanageDeleteParameters.unmanag.description: Flag to indicate delete rather than detach for unmanaged management groups.

values.name: Delete
values.description: Delete the specified resources from Azure

values.name: Detach
values.description: Keep the specified resources in Azure

ActionOnUnmanageDeleteParameters.unmanag.name: unmanageAction.ResourceGroups
ActionOnUnmanageDeleteParameters.unmanag.description: Flag to indicate delete rather than detach for unmanaged resource groups.

values.name: Delete
values.description: Delete the specified resources from Azure

values.name: Detach
values.description: Keep the specified resources in Azure

ActionOnUnmanageDeleteParameters.unmanag.name: unmanageAction.Resources
ActionOnUnmanageDeleteParameters.unmanag.description: Flag to indicate delete rather than detach for unmanaged resources.

values.name: Delete
values.description: Delete the specified resources from Azure

values.name: Detach
values.description: Keep the specified resources in Azure

ManagementGroupIdParameter.name: managementGroupId
ManagementGroupIdParameter.description: The name of the management group. The name is case insensitive.
